body_html:
Interesting. Actually the calling stack is TF_NewSession(), run() then TF_DeleteSession(), loop for 300+ times, and this chart indicates there is a growing memory usage and Xcode reported AlignedMalloc was the only leaky one, where you can see the a liner increase - possibly caused by an incomplete object release.

Suspected Memory Leak Accumulation

Interesting. Actually the calling stack is TF_NewSession(), run() then TF_DeleteSession(), loop for 300+ times, and this chart indicates there is a growing memory usage and Xcode reported AlignedMalloc was the only leaky one, where you can see the a liner increase - possibly caused by an incomplete object release.

body:
Interesting. Actually the calling stack is `TF_NewSession()`, `run()` then `TF_DeleteSession()`, loop for 300+ times, and this chart indicates there is a growing memory usage and Xcode reported `AlignedMalloc` was the only leaky one, where you can see the a liner increase - possibly caused by an incomplete object release.

Suspected Memory Leak Accumulation
